page.title: 18Lundy's Past.
page.content: on William de Marisco by Henry II remained unpaid.In 1237 William de Marisco was implicated in a plot to murder Henry III.In 1242 a Norfolk baron with 13 men managed to land on Lundy in mist and William and his followers were captured and taken to London.William was tried-and then hung drawn and quartered. Marisco Castle has nothing to do with the Mariscos (they lived at Bull's Paradise).It was built by an agent of the crown after the expulsion of the Mariscos. In the late 1500s Lundy was a base for several notorious pirates.In 1625 three Turkish pirates were in occupation and in the 1630's the notorious Captain John Nutt used it as one of his headquarters. In 1643 Thomas Bushell became govenor of the castle for King Charles.{(cont)
